title: How do I extract fonts that used into ppt/pptx file?
content:
In File Explorer, navigate to the zip file containing your desired fonts. Right-click it and select Extract All…. Choose the destination for the extracted files, then click Extract. Now that the font files have been extracted, right-click the one you want to use and select Install.

Fonts Sonic
creator: ghanajaksl

title: Website not updating in Firefox
content: I maintain a website that I update on a regular basis. For the past month, none of the updates have shown up in Firefox. I've refreshed the page, cleared the cache, logged out and logged back in. Nothing has helped. With other browsers, there's no problem -- Chrome, Opera and Safari all show the website updates as soon as I post them. I'm using Firefox 122.0.1 (64-bit) on MacOS Sonoma 14.2.1 (MacBook Pro 14-inch 2023). The website uses WordPress, hosted by DreamHost. I have two other WordPress websites, both hosted by WordPress, and Firefox is showing updates with no problem. I'm querying DreamHost on this as well, but I suspect they'll must say it's a Firefox problem.

title: Problems with google Maps
content: Hello all, I just wanted to know if you are having problems with Firefox running google maps. The map itself it is fine... you can zoom in and zoom out.. however, when you try to find something (adding a location), just in the footer says "loading... (cargando...in spanish)(see screenshot)" and it never stops and never finds the search. I can work well google maps with my smartphone using the same wifi connection. So it is not a connection problem. I have a good wifi here and the browser runs perfectly when I do other searchs. Apparently it only happens with google maps. I do not have other browser installed... I am happy with Firefox... but, if I do not fix this problem... I am afraid that I will have to install Chrome... and see if it works and perhaps I will keep Chrome and uninstall Firefox. Could it be some kind of incompatibility with Firefox and Google? Perhaps a bug?. Thanks for your help!

title: Issue Installing Add-on on Gmail
content:
Hello Firefox Community,

I'm reaching out because I've encountered an issue while trying to install an add-on on Gmail, and I'm hoping someone here might be able to help me out. The issue happens with any add-on, but the one I wanted to install is (https://workspace.google.com/u/0/marketplace/app/todoist_for_gmail/815972520808)

When trying to install an add-on, I get directed through to give the add-on permissions and I get thrown to the following error 400 each time (see screenshots). I've already tried a few troubleshooting steps, such as clearing my browser cache and cookies, disabling other add-ons/extensions, and even restarting my browser, but unfortunately, none of these actions have resolved the issue.

I'm sure this problem is a more general issue with Firefox. I reached out go Google and they could not help and the installation was successful on Chrome. I also tried installing other add-ons and a similar problem occurs. If anyone else has experienced a similar problem or has any suggestions for troubleshooting steps I can try, I would greatly appreciate your insights.

Additionally, if there's any specific information or logs I should provide to help diagnose the issue further, please let me know, and I'll do my best to provide whatever is needed.

Thank you in advance for any assistance you can offer!

Best regards, Kamil
creator: firefox.voice188

title: Firefox and Gmail
content: For several weeks now, whenever I close Firefox and shut down my iMac and open Gmail the next day, Gmail seems to forget which emails I have already read, and it marks many old emails as unread. Deleting the Google cache and cookies helps, but only temporarily. This problem doesn't seem to occur when using a different browser, such as Safari, or when using the built-in MacOS email client. Therefore, I'm thinking it's a buggy interaction between Firefox and Gmail. I didn't used to have this problem, so perhaps it's related to a Firefox update? Anyhow, I'm hoping someone can help. Thanks!
creator: vgersigny
